intro: Fuertesimalva killipii, commonly known as the Killip's firebush, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red-orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
